title: Philip Trousdell
text:
<a href="Lieutenant-general%20%28United%20Kingdom%29">Lieutenant General</a> Sir Philip Charles Cornwallis Trousdell (born 13 August 1948) is a retired senior <a href="British%20Army">British Army</a> <a href="Officer%20%28armed%20forces%29">officer</a> who was <a href="General%20Officer%20Commanding">General Officer Commanding</a> <a href="Northern%20Ireland">Northern Ireland</a> and <a href="List%20of%20Governors%20and%20Commandants%20of%20Sandhurst">Commandant</a> of the <a href="Royal%20Military%20Academy%20Sandhurst">Royal Military Academy Sandhurst</a>. He was commanding officer of the 2nd Battalion, Royal Irish Rangers before advancing to high command and in that capacity was deployed to <a href="Bosnia-Herzegovina">Bosnia-Herzegovina</a>.
Early life.
Trousdell was educated at <a href="Berkhamsted%20School">Berkhamsted School</a>, <a href="Hertfordshire">Hertfordshire</a>, <a href="England">England</a>.
Military career.
Trousdell was <a href="Officer%20%28armed%20forces%29">commissioned</a> into the <a href="Royal%20Irish%20Rangers">Royal Irish Rangers</a> on 2 August 1968 as a <a href="second%20lieutenant">second lieutenant</a>. He was promoted to <a href="Lieutenant%20%28British%20Army%20and%20Royal%20Marines%29">lieutenant</a> on 2 February 1970, Between 1968 and 1974, he served in the <a href="United%20Kingdom">United Kingdom</a>, <a href="Gibraltar">Gibraltar</a>, <a href="Libya">Libya</a>, <a href="Bahrain">Bahrain</a>, <a href="Oman">Oman</a> and <a href="Northern%20Ireland">Northern Ireland</a>. He was promoted to <a href="captain%20%28British%20Army%20and%20Royal%20Marines%29">captain</a> on 2 August 1974. Between 1974 and 1977, he served as <a href="Military%20communications">Signals</a> Officer and <a href="Adjutant">Adjutant</a> of 2nd Battalion, Royal Irish Rangers.
Having attended the <a href="Staff%20College%2C%20Camberley">Staff College, Camberley</a>, Trousdell was promoted to <a href="Major%20%28United%20Kingdom%29">major</a> on 30 September 1980. He then became an instructor in the Junior wing of Camberley. He returned to 2nd Battalion, Royal Irish Rangers as a <a href="Company%20Commander">Company Commander</a>. He served as <a href="Officer%20Commanding">Officer Commanding</a> a <a href="Company%20%28military%20unit%29">company</a> in <a href="Berlin">Berlin</a>, <a href="Germany">Germany</a> and in <a href="Dover">Dover</a>, <a href="Kent">Kent</a>. From 1985 to 1987, he was posted to the <a href="Ministry%20of%20Defence%20%28United%20Kingdom%29">Ministry of Defence</a> as a <a href="Military%20Assistant">Military Assistant</a> to the <a href="Assistant%20Chief%20of%20the%20General%20Staff%20%28United%20Kingdom%29">Assistant Chief of the General Staff</a>, then Major-General <a href="John%20MacMillan%20%28British%20Army%20officer%29">John MacMillan</a>. He was promoted to <a href="Lieutenant%20colonel%20%28United%20Kingdom%29">lieutenant colonel</a> on 31 December 1986, with seniority from 30 June 1986. He spent the next two years as a member of the <a href="Directing%20Staff">Directing Staff</a> at Camberley.
Trousdell was <a href="Commanding%20Officer">Commanding Officer</a> of 1Bn <a href="Royal%20Irish%20Rangers">Royal Irish Rangers</a> from February 1989 to August 1991. He attended the <a href="Higher%20Command%20and%20Staff%20Course">Higher Command and Staff Course</a>, graduating in April 1991, and was promoted to <a href="Colonel%20%28United%20Kingdom%29">colonel</a> on 30 June 1991. From August 1991 to January 1992, he was based in Northern Ireland, overseeing the amalgamation of the <a href="Ulster%20Defence%20Regiment">Ulster Defence Regiment</a> and the <a href="Royal%20Irish%20Rangers">Royal Irish Rangers</a> into the <a href="Royal%20Irish%20Regiment%20%281992%29">Royal Irish Regiment</a>. He was promoted to <a href="Brigadier%20%28United%20Kingdom%29">brigadier</a> on 31 December 1991, with seniority from 30 June 1991. From January 1992 to November 1993, he was <a href="commanding%20officer">commanding officer</a> of the <a href="British%20Forces%20Overseas%20Hong%20Kong">48 Gurkha Brigade</a> in <a href="Hong%20Kong">Hong Kong</a>. He was posted to the <a href="Ministry%20of%20Defence%20%28United%20Kingdom%29">Ministry of Defence</a> from November 1993 until January 1997 as Director of <a href="Public%20Relations">Public Relations</a> (Army).
Trousdell was promoted to <a href="Major-general%20%28United%20Kingdom%29">major-general</a> on 23 April 1997 with seniority from 22 February 1996. He served as Chief of Staff at Headquarters <a href="Commander%20Land%20Forces">Land Command</a> from 1997 to 2000. On 6 March 2000, he was appointed Deputy Commander of Operations for the <a href="SFOR">Stabilisation Force in Bosnia-Herzegovina</a>. In 2001 he was appointed <a href="List%20of%20Governors%20and%20Commandants%20of%20Sandhurst">Commandant of the Royal Military Academy Sandhurst</a>. On 13 January 2003, he was promoted to <a href="Lieutenant-general%20%28United%20Kingdom%29">lieutenant-general</a> and appointed <a href="General%20Officer%20Commanding">General Officer Commanding</a> <a href="Northern%20Ireland">Northern Ireland</a>. He retired on 10 August 2005.
Later life.
Trousdell has been Chairman of the <a href="Civil%20Nuclear%20Police%20Authority">Civil Nuclear Police Authority</a> since 29 September 2011, having been <a href="interim%20management">interim</a> Chairman from 20 May 2011. He is a <a href="trustee">trustee</a> of <a href="Help%20for%20Heroes">Help for Heroes</a>.
Honours and decorations.
Trousdell was appointed <a href="Commander%20of%20the%20Order%20of%20the%20Bath">Commander of the Order of the Bath</a> (CB) in the <a href="2000%20Birthday%20Honours">2000</a> <a href="Queen%27s%20Birthday%20Honours">Queen's Birthday Honours</a>. In the <a href="2004%20Birthday%20Honours">2004</a> Queen's Birthday Honours, he was appointed <a href="Knight%20Commander%20of%20the%20Order%20of%20the%20British%20Empire">Knight Commander of the Order of the British Empire</a> (KBE).
He held the <a href="title%20of%20honor">honorary</a> position of <a href="Colonel%20%28United%20Kingdom%29">Colonel</a> of <a href="10%20Queen%27s%20Own%20Gurkha%20Logistic%20Regiment%20RLC">The Queen's Own Gurkha Transport Regiment</a> from 27 October 1993 to 1 July 2003. He was appointed <a href="Deputy%20Colonel">Deputy Colonel</a> of <a href="Royal%20Irish%20Regiment%20%281992%29">The Royal Irish Regiment</a> on 1 July 1996, relinquishing the appointment on 1 July 2001 when he was appointed Colonel of the Regiment. On 1 April 2001, he was appointed <a href="Colonel%20Commandant">Colonel Commandant</a> of <a href="Media%20Operations%20Group%20%28Volunteers%29">Media Operations Group (Volunteers)</a>, and his tenure expired on 1 April 2006. He was appointed Colonel Commandant of the <a href="Brigade%20of%20Gurkhas">Brigade of Gurkhas</a> from 1 July 2003 to 1 April 2007.
References.
